name: My Blog Site
description: A sample blog site generated using our static site generator

main.classNames: flex-1 grid grid-cols-3 gap-4 p-4 px-16

blogPost.classNames: p-6 max-w-2xl mx-auto bg-white rounded-lg shadow-md

content.title: Getting Started with Go
content.author: John Doe
content.content: Go is a statically typed, compiled programming language designed at Google by Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, and Ken Thompson. It is syntactically similar to C, but with memory safety, garbage collection, structural typing, and CSP-style concurrency.

content.title: Getting Started with Python
content.author: Jane Smith
content.content: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its clear syntax and readability. It is widely used in web development, scientific computing, artificial intelligence, and more.

content.title: Getting Started with JavaScript
content.author: Alice Johnson
content.content: JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language used to create interactive web pages. It is the backbone of modern web development and is supported by all modern browsers.

content.title: Getting Started with React
content.author: Bob Brown
content.content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It is used to create interactive web applications and is supported by all modern browsers.

content.title: Getting Started with Vue.js
content.author: Charlie Davis
content.content: Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. It is designed to be incrementally adoptable and is supported by all modern browsers.
